{"id":1055146878,"question_id":4,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"8 months, 3 weeks","timestamp":1695274860,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"2 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1055146878/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"44.2 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public double findMedianSortedArrays(int[] nums1, int[] nums2) {\n        int len1 = nums1.length;\n        int len2 = nums2.length;\n        \n        int idx1=0;\n        int idx2=0;\n        \n        if(len1+len2==0)\n            return 0;\n        \n        int curr=0;\n        int prev=0;\n            \n        \n        while(idx1+idx2<=(len1+len2)/2){\n\n            prev= curr;\n            \n            if(idx1<len1 && idx2<len2){\n                if(nums1[idx1]<= nums2[idx2]){\n                    curr=nums1[idx1];\n                    \n                    idx1++;\n                }else{\n                    curr=nums2[idx2];\n                    idx2++;\n\n                }\n                               \n            }else if(idx1<len1){\n                \n                curr=nums1[idx1];\n                idx1++;\n            }else{\n                \n                 curr=nums2[idx2];\n                idx2++;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        \n        if((len1+len2)%2==0)\n          return (Double.valueOf(prev)+Double.valueOf(curr))/2;\n        \n        \n        return Double.valueOf(curr);\n        \n        \n        \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
